member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.PowerModes
member.summary: Defines identifiers for power mode events reported by the operating system.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.PowerModes.Resume
member.summary: The operating system is about to resume from a suspended state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.PowerModes.StatusChange
member.summary: A power mode status notification event has been raised by the operating system. This might indicate a weak or charging battery, a transition between AC power and battery, or another change in the status of the system power supply.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.PowerModes.Suspend
member.summary: The operating system is about to be suspended.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Win32.SessionEndingEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to cancel the user request to end the session.
member.returns: to cancel the user request to end the session; otherwise, .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Win32.SessionEndingEventArgs.Reason
member.summary: Gets the reason the session is ending.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.SessionEndReasons
member.summary: Defines identifiers that represent how the current logon session is ending.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.SessionEndReasons.Logoff
member.summary: The user is logging off and ending the current user session. The operating system continues to run.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.SessionEndReasons.SystemShutdown
member.summary: The operating system is shutting down.

member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event.
member.param: The source of the event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.SessionSwitchReason
member.summary: Defines identifiers used to represent the type of a session switch event.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.SessionSwitchReason.ConsoleConnect
member.summary: A session has been connected from the console.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.SessionSwitchReason.ConsoleDisconnect
member.summary: A session has been disconnected from the console.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.SessionSwitchReason.RemoteConnect
member.summary: A session has been connected from a remote connection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.SessionSwitchReason.RemoteDisconnect
member.summary: A session has been disconnected from a remote connection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.SessionSwitchReason.SessionLock
member.summary: A session has been locked.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.SessionSwitchReason.SessionLogoff
member.summary: A user has logged off from a session.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.SessionSwitchReason.SessionLogon
member.summary: A user has logged on to a session.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.SessionSwitchReason.SessionRemoteControl
member.summary: A session has changed its status to or from remote controlled mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.SessionSwitchReason.SessionUnlock
member.summary: A session has been unlocked.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.SystemEvents
member.summary: Provides access to system event notifications. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.SystemEvents.CreateTimer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new window timer associated with the system events window.
member.param: Specifies the interval between timer notifications, in milliseconds.
member.returns: The ID of the new timer.
member.exception: The interval is less than or equal to zero.
System event notifications are not supported under the current context. Server processes, for example, might not support global system event notifications.
The attempt to create a system events window thread did not succeed, or the attempt to create the timer did not succeed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Win32.SystemEvents.DisplaySettingsChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the user changes the display settings.
member.exception: System event notifications are not supported under the current context. Server processes, for example, might not support global system event notifications.
The attempt to create a system events window thread did not succeed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Win32.SystemEvents.DisplaySettingsChanging
member.summary: Occurs when the display settings are changing.
member.exception: System event notifications are not supported under the current context. Server processes, for example, might not support global system event notifications.
The attempt to create a system events window thread did not succeed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Win32.SystemEvents.EventsThreadShutdown
member.summary: Occurs before the thread that listens for system events is terminated.
member.exception: System event notifications are not supported under the current context. Server processes, for example, might not support global system event notifications.
The attempt to create a system events window thread did not succeed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Win32.SystemEvents.InstalledFontsChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the user adds fonts to or removes fonts from the system.
member.exception: System event notifications are not supported under the current context. Server processes, for example, might not support global system event notifications.
The attempt to create a system events window thread did not succeed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.SystemEvents.InvokeOnEventsThread(System.Delegate)
member.summary: Invokes the specified delegate using the thread that listens for system events.
member.param: A delegate to invoke using the thread that listens for system events.
member.exception: System event notifications are not supported under the current context. Server processes, for example, might not support global system event notifications.
The attempt to create a system events window thread did not succeed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.SystemEvents.KillTimer(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Terminates the timer specified by the given id.
member.param: The ID of the timer to terminate.
member.exception: System event notifications are not supported under the current context. Server processes, for example, might not support global system event notifications.
The attempt to create a system events window thread did not succeed, or the attempt to terminate the timer did not succeed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Win32.SystemEvents.LowMemory
member.summary: Occurs when the system is running out of available RAM.
member.exception: System event notifications are not supported under the current context. Server processes, for example, might not support global system event notifications.
The attempt to create a system events window thread did not succeed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Win32.SystemEvents.PaletteChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the user switches to an application that uses a different palette.
member.exception: System event notifications are not supported under the current context. Server processes, for example, might not support global system event notifications.
The attempt to create a system events window thread did not succeed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Win32.SystemEvents.PowerModeChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the user suspends or resumes the system.
member.exception: System event notifications are not supported under the current context. Server processes, for example, might not support global system event notifications.
The attempt to create a system events window thread did not succeed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Win32.SystemEvents.SessionEnded
member.summary: Occurs when the user is logging off or shutting down the system.
member.exception: System event notifications are not supported under the current context. Server processes, for example, might not support global system event notifications.
The attempt to create a system events window thread did not succeed.

member.summary: Occurs when the user is trying to log off or shut down the system.
member.exception: System event notifications are not supported under the current context. Server processes, for example, might not support global system event notifications.
The attempt to create a system events window thread did not succeed.

member.summary: Occurs when the currently logged-in user has changed.
member.exception: System event notifications are not supported under the current context. Server processes, for example, might not support global system event notifications.
The attempt to create a system events window thread did not succeed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.UserPreferenceCategory
member.summary: Defines identifiers that represent categories of user preferences.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.UserPreferenceCategory.Accessibility
member.summary: Indicates user preferences associated with accessibility features of the system for users with disabilities.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.UserPreferenceCategory.Color
member.summary: Indicates user preferences associated with system colors. This category includes such as the default color of windows or menus.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.UserPreferenceCategory.Desktop
member.summary: Indicates user preferences associated with the system desktop. This category includes the background image or background image layout of the desktop.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.UserPreferenceCategory.General
member.summary: Indicates user preferences that are not associated with any other category.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.UserPreferenceCategory.Icon
member.summary: Indicates user preferences for icon settings, including icon height and spacing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.UserPreferenceCategory.Keyboard
member.summary: Indicates user preferences for keyboard settings, such as the key down repeat rate and delay.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.UserPreferenceCategory.Locale
member.summary: Indicates changes in user preferences for regional settings, such as the character encoding and culture strings.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.UserPreferenceCategory.Menu
member.summary: Indicates user preferences for menu settings, such as menu delays and text alignment.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.UserPreferenceCategory.Mouse
member.summary: Indicates user preferences for mouse settings, such as double-click time and mouse sensitivity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.UserPreferenceCategory.Policy
member.summary: Indicates user preferences for policy settings, such as user rights and access levels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.UserPreferenceCategory.Power
member.summary: Indicates the user preferences for system power settings. This category includes power feature settings, such as the idle time before the system automatically enters low power mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.UserPreferenceCategory.Screensaver
member.summary: Indicates user preferences associated with the screensaver.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.UserPreferenceCategory.VisualStyle
member.summary: Indicates user preferences associated with visual styles, such as enabling or disabling visual styles and switching from one visual style to another.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Win32.UserPreferenceCategory.Window
member.summary: Indicates user preferences associated with the dimensions and characteristics of windows on the system.
